comment.text: Catalyzes the ferrous insertion into protoporphyrin IX.
Inhibited by nitric oxide (NO). The 2Fe-2S cluster could act as a NO sensor.
Porphyrin-containing compound metabolism; protoheme biosynthesis; protoheme from protoporphyrin-IX: step 1/1.

disease.name: Erythropoietic protoporphyria
disease.description: A form of porphyria. Porphyrias are inherited defects in the biosynthesis of heme, resulting in the accumulation and increased excretion of porphyrins or porphyrin precursors. They are classified as erythropoietic or hepatic, depending on whether the enzyme deficiency occurs in red blood cells or in the liver. Erythropoietic protoporphyria is marked by excessive protoporphyrin in erythrocytes, plasma, liver and feces, and by widely varying photosensitive skin changes ranging from a burning or pruritic sensation to erythema, edema and wheals.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

property.value: P:generation of precursor metabolites and energy

feature.description: In EPP; autosomal recessive EPP; enzyme retains 18% of activity.

In EPP; enzyme retains 12% of activity; dbSNP:rs761962617.
In EPP; autosomal recessive EPP; enzyme retains 52% of activity.
In EPP; unchanged activity; but increased thermolability; dbSNP:rs118204037.
In EPP; autosomal recessive EPP; enzyme retains 19% of activity; dbSNP:rs150146721.
In EPP; autosomal recessive EPP; enzyme retains 37% of activity.
In EPP; no detectable enzymatic activity.
